value: File:View from Armadale Castle towards Armadale.jpg
View from Armadale Castle towards Armadale

are small towns at the southern tip of the
on the "mainland" of Scotland.  This was one of the main ways of reaching Skye for many years, but has diminished in practical significance with the construction of the Skye Bridge at
.  It's still a picturesque way to reach the town, however; bicycles welcome.
Reasonably regular bus travel to and from either
. You can change at Broadford to reach either destination as well.
It is a short walk between the pier, village and castle.

value: name=Armadale Castle and the Clan Donald Centre
content=Ancestral home of the MacDonalds, on a large and spacious estate around the Castle. Museum and attractive grounds (fee).
The views from the village and pier towards the mainland are attrcative.
content=(see above under "See") has a few cottages.
